you could reinstall mysql from source to /usr/local & this way you would know exactly where your files are located, i.e the my.cnf would only be in /etc/my.cnf but you would have to sudo apt-get --purge remove mysql if you installed through apt-get or uninstall & reinstall using aptitude to better fix deps
